text: Human immunodeficiency virus - associated Hodgkin 's disease derives from post-germinal center B cells .
Human immunodeficiency virus - associated Hodgkin 's disease ( HIV-HD ) displays several peculiarities when compared with HD of the general population .
These include overrepresentation of clinically aggressive histologic types and frequent infection of Reed-Sternberg ( RS ) cells by Epstein-Barr virus ( EBV ) .

Recently , we have reported that the histogenesis of HD of the general population may be assessed by monitoring the expression pattern of <extra_id_0> BCL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a transcription factor expressed in germinal center ( GC ) B cells , and of <extra_id_0> CD138 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> syndecan-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> syn-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , a proteoglycan associated with post-GC , terminal B-cell differentiation .
In this study , we have applied these two markers to the study of HIV-HD histogenesis and correlated their expression status to the virologic features of this disease .

We have found that RS cells of all histologic categories of HIV-HD consistently display the <extra_id_0> BCL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( - ) / <extra_id_0> syn-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( + ) phenotype and thus reflect post-GC B cells .

Although <extra_id_0> BCL-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( - ) / <extra_id_0> syn-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( + ) RS cells of HIV-HD express <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , they are not surrounded by <extra_id_0> CD40 ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - positive ( <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + ) reactive T lymphocytes , which , in HD of the general population , are thought to regulate the disease phenotype through <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> interactions .

Conversely , RS cells of virtually all HIV-HD express the EBV-encoded <extra_id_0> latent membrane protein 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> LMP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , which , being functionally homologous to <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , may contribute , at least in part , to the modulation of the HIV-HD phenotype .
